Sentence: Roughly one hundred years later, Victoria appears in a London park on a winter afternoon with Lin and Lin's daughter Cathy
When Cathy exits to play elsewhere, Lin informs Victoria that she (Victoria) is a lesbian, and she (Victoria) asks Victoria to go to a movie with her (Victoria)
Lin enters when Martin leaves and tells Victoria that her (Victoria) brother, a soldier, has died in Belfast
When Lin and Cathy get into a fight, they lose track of Victoria's son Tommy
Later, on a summer night, Lin, Victoria, and Edward come to the park to hold a ceremony for a sex goddess
By late summer, Lin, Victoria, and Edward have moved in together
